document_data.name: Punt
document_data.mainbody: '''Punts''' were a type of flat-bottomed boat used in calm waters, similar to [[rowboat]]s. Unlike rowboats, which were propelled by [[oar]]s, punts were customarily propelled with the use of poles pushed against the riverbed or lakebed.

Notable Users.Individuals:
* [[Goodwin]] of [[Haywood]] used a punt to navigate the [[Swamp of Nether]] in [[1371 DR]], but the ship began sinking shortly after a [[black dragon]] rose up beneath it.<ref>
* [[Kao Chou Tang]] used a punt to navigate the [[Nameless swamp (Dragon Coast)|nameless swamp]] of the [[Dragon Coast]].<ref>
Notable Users.Nations & Settlements:
* Those in the city-state of [[Cursrah]] used punts to navigate its lake.
* The [[frost giant]]s of [[Svardborg]] utilized giant-sized punts, comparable in size to that of a [[human]] [[longship]], made from frost-covered wood. They could hold up to two [[giant]]s at a time and carry {{SI|10|ton|k|long=yes}} of cargo. It would take up to eight humans or [[demihuman]]s to move one of these punts.<ref>
* In the land of [[Rashemen]], the people of [[Taporan]] commonly used punts to transport both goods and people along the [[River Tir]].
* The [[derro]] of the [[Shadow Kingdom]] sometimes used punts to navigate the rivers of the [[Underdark]].<ref>{{Cite dungeon/20/The Ship of Night|14}}
* In the land of [[Thindol]], punts were commonly used as a form of hireable transportation in [[Delselar]] to reach different parts of the {{SIAdj|3|mile|long=yes|adj=long}} town that stretched along the [[River Dolsel]].
Notable Users.Religions: * Punts were among the many types of small seacraft that [[Wavetamer]]s, [[specialty priest]]s in the [[Church of Valkur]], could expertly guide down rapid streams.<ref>
